channel.title: pzsette's web page
channel.description: Recent content on pzsette's web page

item.title: About me üôãüèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
item.description: I’m software engineering from Florence, at the moment i’m working on my thesis to obtain my master degree. I’m learning how to plan and design software architectures to develop nice and usable products. During my years at university I experienced with different tools and programming languages such as Java, Python, JS and Typescript in many different fields. In my free time I’ve also developed some mobile apps using Flutter framework.

item.title: Cultmedia Web Annotator
item.description: Barchelor Thesis project: A web application for emotional video-compositing The goal of this thesis work was the realization of a web-application that allows to manage and compose together a set videoclips trough a specifical video-editor, suggesting and helping the user during the choice of files relyng of their emotional characterization. The main user interfaces are two: Video-editor, which allows to merge video sequences taken from the databes and filtering them trough specific paramenters.

item.title: GPInfo
item.description: Telegram bot to quickly check the F1 or MotoGP calender or next gp time. The bot is written in PHP and hosted on Altervista. Screenshot

item.title: Library Seat Reservation
item.description: LibrarySeatReservation is a web application for the management of seat reservations in the study rooms of the libraries of Florence. Work done together with n3d1117 and ocrim1996. Features Configurable queue system to prevent server overload TimescaleDB database integration for storing and retrieving time-based reservations Real-time admin notifications using RSocket protocol Use of JWT for authentication and authorization Modules Check out the following modules: frontend built with Angular backend built with Java EE 8 gateway built with Java EE 8 Screenshots

item.title: Pulizia Strade App
item.description: App Pages Map page Search page Favourites page Tools The main tools used are: Flutter: native framework for app development, written in Dart. Google Maps API: embedded map. Firebase Cloud Messaging: push notification. Python: backend services.

item.title: Xplorer App
item.description: Currently with some friends i’m develping an app to promote tourism and actitivies in my territory. I’m working on the frontend side (iOS and Android app, desktop and mobile website). The framework i’m using is Ionic alongside with Angular and Capacitor.
